org.webcycle.hexml
Class hexml

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--org.webcycle.hexml.hexml
public class hexml
extends java.lang.Object

The primary utility class; methods for streaming XML with hexml types.

nameOf

public static java.lang.String nameOf(java.lang.Object o)
                               throws java.lang.NoSuchFieldException,
                                      java.lang.IllegalAccessException
Convenience method to get the standard Hexml field for storing the name of an object, which is usually the tag name. The field should be public and is named by the HEXMLNAME constant.
Throws:
java.lang.NoSuchFieldException - when there is no field named by HEXMLNAME
java.lang.IllegalAccessException - when the field is not public.

elementsOf

public static HexmlElements elementsOf(java.lang.Object o)
                                throws java.lang.NoSuchFieldException,
                                       java.lang.IllegalAccessException
Convenience method to get the standard Hexml field for storing elements in a container. The field should be public and is named by the HEXMLELEMENTS constant.
Throws:
java.lang.NoSuchFieldException - when there is no field named by HEXMLELEMENTS
java.lang.IllegalAccessException - when the field is not public.

attributesOf

public static iHexmlAttributes attributesOf(java.lang.Object o)
                                     throws java.lang.NoSuchFieldException,
                                            java.lang.IllegalAccessException
Convenience method to get the standard Hexml field for storing attributes. The field should be public and is named by the HEXMLATTRIBUTES constant.
Throws:
java.lang.NoSuchFieldException - when there is no field named by HEXMLATTRIBUTES
java.lang.IllegalAccessException - when the field is not public.

streamContainer

public static java.lang.String streamContainer(java.lang.String name,
                                               iHexmlAttributes a,
                                               HexmlElements e)
Stream a collection. Both attributes and elements may be null.

streamAtom

public static java.lang.String streamAtom(java.lang.String name,
                                          iHexmlAttributes a)
stream an atomic object, of the form <name attributes /> where attributes could be null.

stream

public static java.lang.String stream(java.lang.Object o)
Using reflection, attempt to stream the object. This looks for fields that represent the name, the attributes, and the elements by their standard names given by HEXMLNAME, HEXMLATTRIBUTES, HEXMLELEMENTS. The object is considered a container if there is a field for the elements, even if the field is itself null.
